jparsec.model

Class Extinction

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.model.Extinction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Extinction
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A class to model the extinction towards the ISM.

    The model determines the total absorption at wavelengths between 0.10 and 3.33 um using the algorithm developed by Cardelli, Clayton, and Mathis (1989) [ApJ 345 245] .

    Code based on the original Doug Welch's 'Excellent' Absorption Law Calculator in Javascript.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:

    • Field Detail

      • rv

        public double rv
        The ratio of total to selective absorption at V.
        This parameters is correlated with the average grain size. Commonly accepted values are 3.1 for the Milky Way and 3.3 for the LMC.

      • av

        public double av
        The total absorption in mags at V.

      • enableExtinction

        public boolean enableExtinction
        Set to true (default value) to enable the extinction

      • maximumWavelengthToComputeExtinction

        public double maximumWavelengthToComputeExtinction
        Holds maximum wavelength to compute extinction in microns. Default value is 3.33 microns. If it is increased (not more than 5.0 microns), the Rieke and Lebofski 1985 law already integrated in the Cardelli 1989 parameterization will be extrapolated up to this wavelength.

      • Extinction

        public Extinction(double rv,
          double BminusV,
          java.lang.String spectralType,
          boolean mainSequence)
           throws JPARSECException
        Constructor for a given B-V color index.
        Parameters:
        rv - The value for rv parameter.
        BminusV - The color index.
        spectralType - The spectral type as it is ussually given: OBAFGKM followed by the subtype number.
        mainSequence - True for a main sequence star, false for a giants (class III).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • compute

        public double compute(double wv)
               throws JPARSECException
        Compute the total absorption at certain wavelength.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The A_lambda parameter (0 if enableExtinction is false).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the wavelength is out of range.

      • getEBminusV

        public double getEBminusV()
        Returns the selective extinction E(B-V) = A(B) - A(v). It is just av/rv.
        Returns:
        The selective extinction.

      • getAv

        public static double getAv(double nH)
        Returns the extinction Av (to be used as input in the instance of Extinction) assuming a column density of hydrogen.

        This method assumes certain relationship between the gas and the dust in the Milky Way, supported by UV studies by Bohlin et al. 1978, Diplas et al. 1994, and Predehl et al. 1995. Values for nH / Av (atoms cm^-2 mag^-1) range from 5.8E21 of the first reference to 1.8E21 of the last one, which is the value used here.

        Parameters:
        nH - in atoms cm^-2.
        Returns:
        The total extinction A in V band.
